semantic_title: Coding Pain Due to Medical Devices, Implants and Grafts
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 19. Chapter 19: Injury, poisoning, and certain other consequences of external causes > g. Complications of care > 2) Pain due to medical devices

content.full_text: Pain associated with devices, implants or grafts left in a surgical site (for example painful hip prosthesis) is assigned to the appropriate code(s) found in Chapter 19, Injury, poisoning, and certain other consequences of external causes. Specific codes for pain due to medical devices are found in the T code section of the ICD-10-CM. Use additional code(s) from category G89 to identify acute or chronic pain due to presence of the device, implant or graft (G89.18 or G89.28). (Evidence: pg no: 86, L44-L46)
content.summary: Pain from medical devices uses T codes from Chapter 19 with additional G89 codes to specify acute or chronic pain (Evidence: pg no: 86, L44-L46)
